subject: Re: [junit] code coverage tool Java
msgSnippet: We are using emma (open source) and Clover, both are great. ... http://uk.promotions.yahoo.com/forgood/environment.html ...
messageBody:
We are using emma (open source) and Clover, both are
great.
--- avinash anand <avinash_anand@...> wrote:

> Can anyone suggest a good code coverage tool for
> Java code. Does JUnit has testing code coverage
> capability.
> I have evaluated Agitar but its very costly $50000
> for 10 licenses, please suggest some opensource or
> cheaper version of them
>
